revised_title: Scattering by a Horizontal Subsurface Penny-Shaped Crack: Analysis and Numerical Results
tldr: This article investigates the scattering of waves by a horizontal subsurface penny-shaped crack under axially symmetric loading. The authors use the boundary integral method to derive integral equations and obtain results for crack opening displacement, stress intensity factors, scattered patterns, and frequency spectra of Rayleigh and back-scattered longitudinal waves. The study also compares the plate-type resonance phenomenon with the plane-strain case.
